intro: Ceropegia kwebensis, commonly known as the Kwebeni ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often pale green or yellowish, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
